doc.title: J.P.Morgan
doc.source_uri: 2025-08-29/Bank of Communications - H First Take 2Q25 profit growth in line while pressure on retail AQ continuesBank of Communicat_2025-08-29

passages.text: This material is neither intended to be distributed to Mainland China investors nor to provide securities investment consultancy services within the territory of Mainland China. This material or any portion hereof may not be reprinted or redistributed without the written consent of J.P. Morgan.
First Take: 2Q25 profit growth in line, while pressure on retail AQ continues.

Our First Take: 2Q25 results - largely in line. BoCom's 2Q25 revenues, PPoP and profits were up \(3\%\) , \(2\%\) , \(2\%\) y/y, respectively, largely in line with our estimates (Table 1). On the positive side, non- fee income grew \(16\%\) y/y, supporting revenue growth. Overall asset quality was stable, with a 9ppt q/q increase in the NPL coverage ratio. On the negative side, NIM contracted 4bps q/q, and fee income dropped \(3\%\) y/y (weaker than at SOE bank peers). The retail NPL ratio increased 15bps q/q. Bottom- line growth was partly supported by a positive tax impact in 2Q (+Rmb1.5bn vs. - Rmb1.9bn income tax expense in 1Q), which may not be sustainable. We expect muted consensus EPS changes and believe the share price may go up, but underperform peers (CCB, ICBC, BOC and PSBC).

- Accretive impact of new capital: BoCom's CET 1 ratio improved 118bps (in line with expectations), to \(11.42\%\) , mainly due to Rmb120bn of capital injection in 2Q, with share count dilution of \(19\%\) .

- Asset quality remained stable: The NPL ratio declined 1bps q/q in 2Q, to \(1.28\%\) , and the NPL coverage ratio improved 9ppt q/q, to \(209.6\%\) . As a result, the LLR ratio improved 9bps q/q, to \(2.68\%\) . Looking into the details, the corporate NPL ratio declined 11bps q/q, while the retail NPL ratio increased 15bps q/q due mainly to credit cards (+68bps q/q) and mortgages (+5bps q/q). The SML ratio increased 7bps q/q, driven by corporate loans (+11bps q/q), while the overdue ratio increased 4bps q/q, largely due to credit cards (+53bps q/q). Please see Table 7 for details.
- Robust non-fee income: Non-fee income grew \(16\%\) y/y in 2Q, helping support revenue growth of \(3\%\) y/y.

- Fee income contracted \(3\%\) y/y: This is weaker than at some other SOE banks that saw positive fee income growth in 2Q25 (e.g., ABC: +32% y/y, BOC: +19% y/y, CCB: +19% y/y). Fees contracted \(3\%\) y/y on a semi-annual basis. Please refer to Table 5 for details. Management disclosed during the analyst briefing that BoCom aimed to achieve better fee growth in 2H25 vs. 1H25.

- NIM contracted 4bps q/q, 2bps worse than JPME: Sequential NIM contraction was larger than in the past two quarters (-1bps q/q in 4Q24 and -2bps q/q in 1Q25). NIM contracted 4bps h/h on a semi-annual basis. Please refer to Table 4 for details.
3328. HK, 3328 HK Price: HK\(6.73 29 Aug 2025 Price Target: HK\)8.20 PT End Date: 31 Dec 2026

J.P. Morgan does and seeks to do business with companies covered in its research reports. As a result, investors should be aware that the firm may have a conflict of interest that could affect the objectivity of this report. Investors should consider this report as only a single factor in making their investment decision.
- We expect muted consensus revisions.
- We believe the stock may go up, but underperform peers (CCB, ICBC, BOC and PSBC).

- NIM: NIM contraction will moderate going forward due to declining deposit cost.- Fee: BoCom aims to achieve better fee growth in 2H25 vs. 1H25. BoCom sees improving investment sentiment since June, following the deposit rate cut.- Asset quality: Expects stable asset quality in 2H25. BoCom is paying attention to real estate, retail and SME loans.- Loan growth: FY25 loan growth will be stable vs. 2024 (i.e., 7.5%).- Payout ratio: Dividend payout ratio no less than 30% for the next three years.
Source: BoCom 1H24-1H25 financial reports, J.P. Morgan estimates.

Table 7: Asset quality metrics breakdown by business type
Source: BoCom 1Q25-2Q25 financial reports.

- Stabilizing NIM: BoCom has seen stabilization in the NIM trend in the past few quarters, and we expect the company to deliver better-than-peers' NIM and NII trends in 2025.  
- BoCom has a high revenue contribution from capital-market-related fees. With the improvements in domestic investment sentiment, BoCom may benefit more than peers.  
- BoCom offers the highest dividend yield among SOE banks, so we believe it should see stronger share price support.

Our Dec- 26 PT of HK\$8.20 is derived via DDM. Our key assumptions include a cost of equity of \(11.25\%\) , a normalized ROE of \(8.2\%\) and a terminal date of 31 December 2027. We derive the valuation for the A- share first and then apply an H- share discount of \(- 15\%\) for BoCom- H.
Source: J.P. Morgan estimates.
Key assumptions/parametersNormalized ROE8.2%Cost of capital11.25%Long-term growth4.5%Fair terminal P/BV0.54A-share fair value (Rmb)8.80CNYHKD1.09H-share discount-15%Dec-25 H-share PT (HK$)8.20

J.P. Morgan uses the following rating system: Overweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will outperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); Neutral (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will perform in line with the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe); and Underweight (over the duration of the price target indicated in this report, we expect this stock will underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe. NR is Not Rated. In this case, J.P. Morgan has removed the rating and, if applicable, the price target, for this stock because of either a lack of a sufficient fundamental basis or for legal, regulatory or policy reasons. The previous rating and, if applicable, the price target, no longer should be relied upon. An NR designation is not a recommendation or a rating. In Americas equity research, some stocks under coverage have a rating but no price target; in these cases, we expect the stock will outperform/perform in line/underperform the average total return of the stocks in the Research Analyst's, or the Research Analyst's team's, coverage universe over the next six to 12 months. index, not to those Research Analysts' coverage universe. If it does not appear in the Important Disclosures section of this report, the certifying Research Analyst's coverage universe can be found on J.P. Morgan's Research website, https://www.jpmorganmarkets.com.
